Summary: Stainless steel ball fixed position in morning sky about 3000 ft. elevation.
trends: There have been 417 other sightings in Phoenix
There were no other sightings in Phoenix on or around August 31st 2002
divs: sighting detailscoming out of my office for a breath of fresh early morning air before giving my nightshift report and going home i observed a stainless steel looking perfectly round sphere stationary in the sky about 2-3 miles south east from my position and about 3000 feet in the sky which would place it's position over the east end of sky harbour airport. the time was about 5:30 or 5:45 am and the sun had not fully risen but the sky was full of light but the globe itself was reflecting bright sunlight. the sphere\globe reflected a gray\silver color just like stainless steel and there were no other features about it. it was just a perfectly round globe devoid of any markings or external material. if one holds a large childs marble at arms length you get the idea of what size i was seeing. this object was perfectly stationary in the sky and clearly visible to anyone who would look up and as i said looked for all the world to be made of stainless steel. i watched it for a short while and first thought it was a tv satalite. i went back into my office, gave report for my shift and went home not thinking anymore about it. a few weeks later coming out of my office for a breath of fresh morning air at the same time as before i saw it again in the same position perfectly stationary in the sky with the early morning sun reflecting off its exterior. i watched it again for a little while wondering just what it was then gave my night shift report and went home. before i drove off the parking lot i took another look but could not see it again. on the way home i began to realize that it could not be a tv satalite because it had no array of antenas or solar panals etc. and it was positioned in the atmosphere only a few thousand feet up. i am a retired rn and have never seen any other odd objects in the sky.
